Field.Name: Secure
Field.Caption: Require Secure Certificate
Field.HelpDefault: When unchecked, the connection to the database can be made without a secure certificate (SSL/TLS If checked, a secure connection is required.)

Field.Name: ParentID
Field.Caption: Parent Content
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. When not set queries for this content should ignore the contentcontrolid, and all records in the content table are in this content. When set, queries should include contentcontrolid for this content id plus any that have this as their parent.

Field.Name: Field Definitions
Field.Caption: Field Definitions
Field.HelpDefault: This is a list of fields used for this content. It does not include fields inherited from parent tables and from the base content.

Field.Name: NavTypeID
Field.Caption: Navigation Type
Field.HelpDefault: Select the appropriate presentation for this add-on on the admin navigator. A link to this addon will included in the appropriate section.

Field.Name: AddonCategoryId
Field.Caption: Navigation Category
Field.HelpDefault: Select the appropriate category that helps the content manager locate this addon.

Field.Name: IconHtml
Field.Caption: Icon Html
Field.HelpDefault: Enter html to be used for the add-on's icon. We recommend 60px by 60px. The image can be a single image, or a vertical set of images treated as a sprite with images for normal, over, active, disabled. ex <div class="iconContentDefault"><i class="fas fa-book"></i></div>

Field.Name: InstalledByCollectionID
Field.Caption: Installed By Collection
Field.HelpDefault: The addon collection that installed this content.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The field name used by the database

Field.Name: Type
Field.Caption: Field Type
Field.HelpDefault: The type for the data in this field. Changing this selection will NOT change the underlying database field so care must be taken to select only fields compatible with the current setting.

Field.Name: Caption
Field.Caption: Caption
Field.HelpDefault: The caption displayed on all editing forms

Field.Name: ReadOnly
Field.Caption: Read Only
Field.HelpDefault: Read only field

Field.Name: NotEditable
Field.Caption: Write Once
Field.HelpDefault: Only editable when the record is added. Then read-only.

Field.Name: LookupContentID
Field.Caption: Lookup Content
Field.HelpDefault: For field type Lookup, the field will store the ID for this content, and this content will populate the lookup for the editor.

Field.Name: LookupContentSqlFilter
Field.Caption: Lookup Content Sql Filter
Field.HelpDefault: For field type Lookup, this will be added to the sql where criteria used to create the lookup select. Use {fieldName} to insert the current record's data from the reference field. For example, in add-ons, to list only the layouts installed by the current add-on's collection '(installedByCollectionId={collectionId})'

Field.Name: RedirectContentID
Field.Caption: Redirect Content
Field.HelpDefault: A redirect field represents a list of records in another table that match this record. Typically this represents the reverse of a lookup (select) field. For example, if this table is articles and another table has article images you may want to see a list of those images here. In article images there would likely be a lookup select for each image where the article is selected. In this case, select the table that has the article images, and enter the name of the field in the article-images table that matches the id of this record.

Field.Name: RedirectID
Field.Caption: Redirect ID-FieldName
Field.HelpDefault: See the Redirect Content explanation.

Field.Name: UniqueName
Field.Caption: Unique
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this value in this field must be unique across all records.

Field.Name: DefaultValue
Field.Caption: Default Value
Field.HelpDefault: Limited to 255 characters. When a new record is created in the admin site, or using the programmatic ContentSet system, this value will be used as the initial value.

Field.Name: Required
Field.Caption: Required
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this field can not be saved blank

Field.Name: Password
Field.Caption: Password
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this field will use the html password field.

Field.Name: Scramble
Field.Caption: Scramble Data in Database
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this value will be not be saved in plain text. It will be scrambled in the database.

Field.Name: HTMLContent
Field.Caption: Edit as Html, not Wysiwyg
Field.HelpDefault: For Html fields. When checked, the default editor should be a text box and not a wysiwyg editor.

Field.Name: IndexColumn
Field.Caption: Admin Listing Column
Field.HelpDefault: In the admin listing page, the column for this field, 0 based started on the left.

Field.Name: IndexWidth
Field.Caption: Admin Listing Width
Field.HelpDefault: A numeric value used to calculate the width of the fields column. If 0, the column is not listed.

Field.Name: Authorable
Field.Caption: Admin Authorable
Field.HelpDefault: When not checked, this field will not appear in the admin edit page.

Field.Name: IndexSortPriority
Field.Caption: Admin Listing Sort Priority
Field.HelpDefault: A numeric value used to determine the default sort column.

Field.Name: IndexSortDirection
Field.Caption: Admin Listing Sort Direction
Field.HelpDefault: If the current sort field, this determines the sort direction.

Field.Name: EditSortPriority
Field.Caption: Admin Edit Sort Priority
Field.HelpDefault: The order in which fields appear in the admin edit screen. A numeric sort for all fields in this content definition.

Field.Name: EditTab
Field.Caption: Admin Edit Tab
Field.HelpDefault: The text name used for the admin editing tab

Field.Name: AdminOnly
Field.Caption: Administrator Only
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, content managers can not see this field, only administrators and developers.

Field.Name: DeveloperOnly
Field.Caption: Developer Only
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, administrators can not see this field, only developers.

Field.Name: ManyToManyContentID
Field.Caption: Many-To-Many Content
Field.HelpDefault: For Many-To-Many fields. This is the other content to which this record is associated.

Field.Name: ManyToManyRuleContentID
Field.Caption: Many-To-Many Rule Content
Field.HelpDefault: For Many-To-Many fields. Select the Rule content created for this relationship. It should have a field for the ID of this record, and a field for the ID of the record in the Many-to-Many content.

Field.Name: ManyToManyRulePrimaryField
Field.Caption: Many-To-Many Rule Primary Field
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the field in the Rule content that holds the ID for this record.

Field.Name: ManyToManyRuleSecondaryField
Field.Caption: Many-To-Many Rule Secondary Field
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the field in the Rule content that holds the ID for the secondary content (selected as the Many-To-Many Content above)

Field.Name: MemberSelectGroupID
Field.Caption: Member Select Group
Field.HelpDefault: For Member Select types, this is the group which holds all the people for the select list.

Field.Name: LookupList
Field.Caption: Lookup List
Field.HelpDefault: for field type lookup, when no Lookup Content is selected, this is a comma delimited list of strings used for the editor selection. A numeric value will be stored in the field representing the item order starting with 1.

Field.Name: editorAddonId
Field.Caption: Custom editor for this Field
Field.HelpDefault: An addon used to edit the data from this field in the admin editor. When set to none, the admin site will use the default editor for the field type.

Field.Name: InstalledByCollectionID
Field.Caption: Installed By Collection
Field.HelpDefault: The addon collection that installed this field.

Field.Name: CookieSupport
Field.Caption: Cookies Supported
Field.HelpDefault: If true, the browser for this visitor supported cookies.

Field.Name: Bot
Field.Caption: Bot Indicated by Browser
Field.HelpDefault: If true, the browser user-agent indicated that this is a bot.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: Name of Visit.

Field.Name: StartTime
Field.Caption: First Hit
Field.HelpDefault: The time and date when this visit started

Field.Name: LastVisitTime
Field.Caption: Last Hit
Field.HelpDefault: The time and date of the last hit for this session.

Field.Name: TimeToLastHit
Field.Caption: Length of Visit (sec)
Field.HelpDefault: Seconds from the first hit to the last

Field.Name: VisitorID
Field.Caption: Visitor ID
Field.HelpDefault: The id of the visitor

Field.Name: VisitorNew
Field.Caption: New Visitor
Field.HelpDefault: If true, this visit was from a new visitor

Field.Name: MemberID
Field.Caption: User ID
Field.HelpDefault: The user who last logged in during this visit.

Field.Name: MemberNew
Field.Caption: New User
Field.HelpDefault: If true, this visit was created by a new user.

Field.Name: REMOTE_ADDR
Field.Caption: IP Address
Field.HelpDefault: The IP address of the visitor for this visit.

Field.Name: Browser
Field.Caption: Browser
Field.HelpDefault: The browser used during this visit.

Field.Name: HTTP_REFERER
Field.Caption: Referer
Field.HelpDefault: If available, the location where this user was before starting the visit.

Field.Name: RefererPathPage
Field.Caption: Referer Path Page
Field.HelpDefault: The path and page of the referer.

Field.Name: PageVisits
Field.Caption: Number of Hits During Visit
Field.HelpDefault: The number of pages or hits recorded during this visit

Field.Name: LoginAttempts
Field.Caption: Login Attempts
Field.HelpDefault: The number of logins attempted during the visit

Field.Name: VisitAuthenticated
Field.Caption: Authenticated
Field.HelpDefault: If true, the user logged in during this visit

Field.Name: CookieSupport
Field.Caption: Cookies Supported
Field.HelpDefault: If true, the browser for this visit supported cookies.

Field.Name: InstalledByCollectionID
Field.Caption: Installed By Collection
Field.HelpDefault: The addon collection that installed this record.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this record, typically set to the name of the person.

Field.Name: FirstName
Field.Caption: First Name
Field.HelpDefault: The first name of this person.

Field.Name: LastName
Field.Caption: Last Name
Field.HelpDefault: The last name of this person.

Field.Name: prefix
Field.Caption: Prefix
Field.HelpDefault: An optional name prefix, such as Mr, Ms, or Mrs

Field.Name: suffix
Field.Caption: Suffix
Field.HelpDefault: An optonal name suffix, such as Jr or II.

Field.Name: title
Field.Caption: Title
Field.HelpDefault: An optional title for this contact, such as CEO or President.

Field.Name: Company
Field.Caption: Company
Field.HelpDefault: A text field that can be used to store the name of the company associated with this person. This field is convenient when the person enters thier own company in an online profile form.

Field.Name: OrganizationID
Field.Caption: Organization
Field.HelpDefault: Select the company/organization for this person. This field is used for membership and account association and will never be available for the user to select online.

Field.Name: Website
Field.Caption: Website
Field.HelpDefault: Website associated with this user.

Field.Name: email
Field.Caption: Email
Field.HelpDefault: Email address

Field.Name: AllowBulkEmail
Field.Caption: Allow Group Email
Field.HelpDefault: Uncheck if you do not want this user to receive email.

Field.Name: blockEmail
Field.Caption: Block Email Requested By User
Field.HelpDefault: This is a list of actions this user may have taken to block email from this site. See the Email Bounce List for details.

Field.Name: cellphone
Field.Caption: Cell Phone
Field.HelpDefault: Cell phone number for this person where they might be called or text messaged.

Field.Name: blockTextMessage
Field.Caption: Block Text Messages
Field.HelpDefault: If not checked, the system can send text messages to this person. check to prevent test messages. This box is checked if the person requests to not receive texts

Field.Name: phone
Field.Caption: Contact/Alternate Phone
Field.HelpDefault: An alternate phone number which may be displayed publically as a contact.

Field.Name: Fax
Field.Caption: Fax
Field.HelpDefault: Fax number for this person

Field.Name: Address
Field.Caption: Address Line 1
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person. The first line of the address.

Field.Name: Address2
Field.Caption: Address Line 2
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person. The second line of the address. Typically suite number, office number, etc.

Field.Name: City
Field.Caption: City
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person.

Field.Name: State
Field.Caption: State
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person.

Field.Name: Zip
Field.Caption: Zip
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person.

Field.Name: Country
Field.Caption: Country
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person.

Field.Name: timeZoneId
Field.Caption: Time Zone
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for the person.

Field.Name: longitude
Field.Caption: Longitude
Field.HelpDefault: Location of the address.

Field.Name: latitude
Field.Caption: Latitude
Field.HelpDefault: Location of the address.

Field.Name: notes
Field.Caption: Notes
Field.HelpDefault: Offline information. Use this text area to add notes about the person that does not appear online.

Field.Name: ResumeFilename
Field.Caption: Resume
Field.HelpDefault: Online information. Use this text area to add notes about the person that does may appear online.

Field.Name: nickName
Field.Caption: Nickname
Field.HelpDefault: Use this field for an online name. Features should use this field to hide a user's real name.

Field.Name: ImageFilename
Field.Caption: Photo
Field.HelpDefault: An image that can be used online for this person as a primary photo. Typically this image would be portrait format and between 300 and 600 px wide.

Field.Name: ImageAltSizeList
Field.Caption: Image Alternate Size List
Field.HelpDefault: Comma seperated list of alternative file sizes created.

Field.Name: ThumbnailFilename
Field.Caption: Avatar 80x80
Field.HelpDefault: An image that can be used online for this person as an icon or avatar. Typically this image would be square, 80px wide and tall.

Field.Name: ThumbnailAltSizeList
Field.Caption: Image Alternate Size List
Field.HelpDefault: Comma seperated list of alternative file sizes created.

Field.Name: Bio
Field.Caption: Bio
Field.HelpDefault: A short text biography (up to 5000 characters) editable by the user in My-Account that can appear on the public website.

Field.Name: LanguageID
Field.Caption: Language
Field.HelpDefault: This select may be used if the site supports multiple languages.

Field.Name: BirthdayDay
Field.Caption: Birthday Day
Field.HelpDefault: The birthday for this person. It may be used for automatic emails (conditional email).

Field.Name: BirthdayMonth
Field.Caption: Birthday Month
Field.HelpDefault: The birthday for this person. It may be used for automatic emails (conditional email).

Field.Name: BirthdayYear
Field.Caption: Birthday Year
Field.HelpDefault: The birthday for this person. It may be used for automatic emails (conditional email).

Field.Name: Username
Field.Caption: Username
Field.HelpDefault: The login username for the person.

Field.Name: Password
Field.Caption: Set Password
Field.HelpDefault: For plain-text password mode (Site Settings, Security) this is the user's password. If plain-text password is disabled, this field should be blank and the hashed password in a different field. To change the password, set it here in Set Password and save.

Field.Name: PasswordHash
Field.Caption: Password Hash
Field.HelpDefault: The login password, encoded for security.

Field.Name: DateExpires
Field.Caption: Login Expires
Field.HelpDefault: If not blank, the person cannot login after this date. Set a future date for temporary access. Set a past date to disable access.

Field.Name: Admin
Field.Caption: Administrator
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this person is an administrator and can edit content.

Field.Name: Developer
Field.Caption: Developer
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this person is a developer and can edit content and advanced features.

Field.Name: AutoLogin
Field.Caption: Allow AutoLogin
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this person will be logged in automatically by recognizing their computer/browser. This feature is only valid if site's security setting allows it.

Field.Name: passwordmodifieddate
Field.Caption: Password Modified Date
Field.HelpDefault: Date when the password was last changed.

Field.Name: ExcludeFromAnalytics
Field.Caption: Exclude From Contensive Analytics
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, the analytics from this user should not be included in reporting. Use this for excluded visitors like internal emplyees.

Field.Name: Visits
Field.Caption: Login Count
Field.HelpDefault: The number of times the user has logged in with the default login process. Custom processes should increment this field as well.

Field.Name: LastVisit
Field.Caption: Last Login
Field.HelpDefault: The last date and time when this user logged in through the default login. Custom processes should set this date as well.

Field.Name: CreatedByVisit
Field.Caption: Allow Purge (created by site visit)
Field.HelpDefault: Checked automatically if this record was created automatically by a visit to the site. These records are considered guest users and may be purged during housekeep processes. There are also other fields that prevent record purge: username, password, email, and non-default name. See preferences for details.

Field.Name: Topics
Field.Caption: Topics
Field.HelpDefault: Topics may used to help the user navigate areas in which they are most interested.

Field.Name: AllowToolsPanel
Field.Caption: (deprecated )Allow Tools Panel
Field.HelpDefault: Uncheck to block the administrator tool panel if this person is checked as an adminstrator.

Field.Name: NotesFilename
Field.Caption: (deprecated) Notes
Field.HelpDefault: Offline information. Use this text area to add notes about the person that does not appear online.

Field.Name: BillName

Field.HelpDefault: deprecated. billing address is the billing contact's address.

Field.Name: AdminMenuModeID
Field.Caption: Admin Menu Mode
Field.HelpDefault: (deprecated)

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the group you will see in the backend as a name for this record. The name is not intended to display to users.

Field.Name: Caption
Field.Caption: Public Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of this group that should be displayed on public pages. For example you make have a group with the name 'Prospects, Free Trial' and a caption 'Signup for a Free Trial'

Field.Name: CopyFilename
Field.Caption: Group Description
Field.HelpDefault: A describe the group that may be visible on the public site.

Field.Name: AllowBulkEmail
Field.Caption: Allow Group Email
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, Group Email, System Email, and Conditional Email can be sent to this group.

Field.Name: PublicJoin
Field.Caption: Allow Public Join
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this group may appear in public lists that uses can join and remove themselves. The My Account addon is an example of this.

Field.Name: SortOrder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: This field can be used to sort the groups.

Field.Name: MembershipReference
Field.Caption: Membership
Field.HelpDefault: This is a list of the membership to this group in the 'Member Rules' data. Member Rules have an expiration date and a selection for a person and a group.

Field.Name: authoringPermissionsReference
Field.Caption: Authoring Permissions
Field.HelpDefault: If any content is checked, user's in this group will be given access to the Admin site and will be able to edit this content.

Field.Name: MemberID
Field.Caption: Member
Field.HelpDefault: The person in the group

Field.Name: GroupID
Field.Caption: Group ID
Field.HelpDefault: The group in which this person is a member.

Field.Name: DateExpires
Field.Caption: Date Expires
Field.HelpDefault: The date and time when this member is no longer in this group.

Field.Name: GroupRoleId
Field.Caption: Group Role
Field.HelpDefault: The role this person has in this group. For example 'President', or 'Committee Chair'.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the organization.

Field.Name: CopyFilename
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: A description that might be made available to the public website.

Field.Name: BriefFilename
Field.Caption: Overview
Field.HelpDefault: A short description that might be used in a list of organizations.

Field.Name: ContactMemberID
Field.Caption: Primary Contact
Field.HelpDefault: The primary contact for this organization. This field can only be set programmatically.

Field.Name: Address1
Field.Caption: Address Line 1
Field.HelpDefault: The first line of the address.

Field.Name: Address2
Field.Caption: Address Line 2
Field.HelpDefault: An option section address line for the address typically used for office number, suite number, etc.

Field.Name: City
Field.Caption: City
Field.HelpDefault: The address's city.

Field.Name: State
Field.Caption: State
Field.HelpDefault: The address's state.

Field.Name: Country
Field.Caption: Country
Field.HelpDefault: The address's country.

Field.Name: Zip
Field.Caption: Zip
Field.HelpDefault: The address's zip of postal code.

Field.Name: Phone
Field.Caption: Phone
Field.HelpDefault: The primary phone number for this organization.

Field.Name: Fax
Field.Caption: Fax
Field.HelpDefault: The fax number for this organization (if applicable).

Field.Name: Web
Field.Caption: Web
Field.HelpDefault: The website for this organization.

Field.Name: Email
Field.Caption: Email
Field.HelpDefault: The primary email address to contact this organization.

Field.Name: Link
Field.Caption: Link
Field.HelpDefault: A link to the organization. This link may be used in conjunction with the website field to display the website, but link to this url. Use this when you want the link to include details that are not required to display.

Field.Name: Viewings
Field.Caption: Viewings
Field.HelpDefault: Can be used to count the number of times the details for this organization are displayed.

Field.Name: Clicks
Field.Caption: Clicks
Field.HelpDefault: Can be used to count the number of times this organization's link is clicked.

Field.Name: ImageFilename
Field.Caption: Image
Field.HelpDefault: Can be used as a larger image for this organization. For exmaple on a details page about this organization.

Field.Name: ThumbNailFilename
Field.Caption: ThumbNail
Field.HelpDefault: Should be used as small representation of an organization, like an avatar. For example within a directory list.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this page. Enter a name you can use in the future to easily recognize and locate this page. This namemay also be used on the public website if other fields are blank, such as the metadata page title, navigation headline, and child page headline.

Field.Name: Copyfilename
Field.Caption: Page Text Block (Legacy)
Field.HelpDefault: This block of text is the legacy copy that appeared on the page before version 19.05.12.23. This is the equivalent of a Text Block in Design Blocks.

Field.Name: addonList
Field.Caption: Add-on List
Field.HelpDefault: Developer Only: This field contains a JSON string that outlines the structure of the page. Use the Page Builder mode on the Tool Panel at the top of the public page to create and edit this feature.

Field.Name: ContentPadding
Field.Caption: Padding Around Content (px)
Field.HelpDefault: When non-zero, the content box will include an inline style specifying this much content padding.

Field.Name: ContactMemberID
Field.Caption: Contact
Field.HelpDefault: When a member of group Site Managers is selected, this page will include a footer with contact information.

Field.Name: IsSecure
Field.Caption: Deprecated. (Requires Secure SSL Connection)
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated. protocol controlled by webserver.

Field.Name: TemplateID
Field.Caption: Template
Field.HelpDefault: When selected, this template will be used the page. When not selected, it will use the template selected for its parent page, or the template selected by the Domain.

Field.Name: AllowHitNotification
Field.Caption: Allow Hit Notification Email
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the page Contact will be notified each time the page is viewed.

Field.Name: AllowReturnLinkDisplay
Field.Caption: Allow 'Return Link' Display
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, if this page is a child of other pages, a page header will be added with navigation breadcrumb

Field.Name: AllowFeedback
Field.Caption: Allow 'Feedback'
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, a footer will be added to the page asking readers for feedback, which will be sent to the page Contact.

Field.Name: AllowMoreInfo
Field.Caption: Allow 'More Info'
Field.HelpDefault: If checked and a contact is selected in the features tab, a footer message will be added to the bottom of the content to provide contact details for more information.

Field.Name: AllowLastModifiedFooter
Field.Caption: Allow 'Last Modified'
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, a footer will be added to the page indicating when and by whome it was last modified.

Field.Name: AllowReviewedFooter
Field.Caption: Allow 'Reviewed Footer'
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, a footer will be added to the page indicating when the page was last reviewed.

Field.Name: DateReviewed
Field.Caption: Date Reviewed
Field.HelpDefault: The date this page was last reviewed. The page is considered reviewed when it is saved, or when the Reviewed button is clicked.

Field.Name: ReviewedBy
Field.Caption: Reviewed By
Field.HelpDefault: The person who last reviewed the page.

Field.Name: PubDate
Field.Caption: Publish Date
Field.HelpDefault: If not empty, this page will be inactive before this date.

Field.Name: DateExpires
Field.Caption: Expiration Date
Field.HelpDefault: If not empty, this page will become inactive on this date.

Field.Name: DateArchive
Field.Caption: Archive Date
Field.HelpDefault: If not emptty, on this date the page will be moved to the Archive Parent.

Field.Name: ArchiveParentID
Field.Caption: Archive Parent Page
Field.HelpDefault: If an archive date is entered, the page will be moved to a child of this page.

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Installs with Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: TriggerConditionID
Field.Caption: Condition
Field.LookupList: Always,If Visitor is in Condition Group,If Visitor is not in Condition Group
Field.HelpDefault: Select a condition to trigger an event by this page.

Field.Name: TriggerConditionGroupID
Field.Caption: Condition Group
Field.HelpDefault: The group used in the trigger event.

Field.Name: TriggerSendSystemEmailID
Field.Caption: Send System Email to Visitor
Field.HelpDefault: If the page trigger is sent to send a system email, select it here.

Field.Name: TriggerAddGroupID
Field.Caption: Add Visitor to Group
Field.HelpDefault: If the page is set to add the viewer to a group, select it here.

Field.Name: TriggerRemoveGroupID
Field.Caption: Remove Visitor from Group
Field.HelpDefault: If the page is set to remove the viewer from a group, select the group here.

Field.Name: onMenus
Field.Caption: On Menus
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. If any menus are checked, this page will appear as a root page on the menu. This will not effect how the page appears as a child page of its parent pages.

Field.Name: ParentID
Field.Caption: Parent Page
Field.HelpDefault: The parent for this page. If ommitted, this is top-level Root page.

Field.Name: AllowInMenus
Field.Caption: Visible in Parent's Flyout Menu
Field.HelpDefault: If unchecked, this page will not appear on navigation mening as a child of its parent.

Field.Name: AllowInChildLists
Field.Caption: Visible in Parent's Child Pages
Field.HelpDefault: If unchecked, this page will never appear in the child list of its parent.

Field.Name: AllowChildListDisplay
Field.Caption: Display Child Pages for This Page
Field.HelpDefault: If unchecked, the default child page list will not display for this page. Child page lists can be added anywhere on the page resulting is a UL-LI list of pages with this as their parent page, and optionally with the matching Child List Name. Child pages not displayed in inline child lists will be automatically added to the default child page list added to the bottom of the page.

Field.Name: ParentListName
Field.Caption: Parent Page 'List Name'
Field.HelpDefault: If this page includes a parent, it can be displayed in any child page list on the parent record's page. If this field is empty, this page will be in the parent page's orphan child list (at the bottom of the page). If this field is populated, it will appear in the list with this name.

Field.Name: ChildListSortMethodID
Field.Caption: Child Pages Sort Method
Field.HelpDefault: Child pages of this page will be sorted by the method selected.

Field.Name: MenuHeadline
Field.Caption: Menu and Child Page Headline for This Page
Field.HelpDefault: If optionally provided, this text will appear in navigation for this page. If ommitted, the page name will be used.

Field.Name: SortOrder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: An optional value used by child page lists to display customer orderig.

Field.Name: AllowBrief
Field.Caption: Display Child Page Overview for This Page
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, the Brief will be include in child lists for this page.

Field.Name: BriefFilename
Field.Caption: Child Page Overview for This Page
Field.HelpDefault: A optional short text block which can be added to child lists including this page.

Field.Name: Link
Field.Caption: Menu Link Override
Field.HelpDefault: If included, clicks to links for this page will be directed to this URL.

Field.Name: Clicks
Field.Caption: Menu Link Override Clicks
Field.HelpDefault: The number of clicks to navigation entries controlled by this page.

Field.Name: menuClass
Field.Caption: Menu class
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. For design only. When included, this text will be added as a class to the list item (generally a LI html element) created for this page.

Field.Name: ChildPagesFound
Field.Caption: Child Pages Found
Field.HelpDefault: Internal Use. This check indicates that this page likely includes child pages.

Field.Name: AllowMetaContentNoFollow
Field.Caption: Block From Search Engines
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this page will not be included in the search engine map (sitemap.xml), and will include meta data telling search engines not to index this page or links it contains.

Field.Name: BlockContent
Field.Caption: Block Users
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this page will be blocked to everyone except those logged in and members of one ore more groups selected below. Administrators will not be blocked.

Field.Name: BlockGroups
Field.Caption: Limit Access to Group Members
Field.HelpDefault: If Block Content is checked, the user can see the content on this page if they are members of any of the groups checked in this list. If no groups are checked the user just needs to be logged in.

Field.Name: BlockSourceID
Field.Caption: Custom Blocking Method
Field.HelpDefault: If the user is blocked from the page, select what the user will see.

Field.Name: CustomBlockMessage
Field.Caption: Custom Blocking Message
Field.HelpDefault: If the user is blocked, this is the custom blocking message the user could see if selected.

Field.Name: RegistrationGroupID
Field.Caption: Register to Group
Field.HelpDefault: If the user successfully views this page, they are added to this group.

Field.Name: LinkAlias
Field.Caption: Link Alias
Field.HelpDefault: The URL created for this page. A URL can only be used for one page. You can add more than one URL to the list, but the only way to remove a Link Alias from a page is to assign it to another page. Dynamic menuing will always display the top-most entry in the list for this page.

Field.Name: Topics
Field.Caption: Topics
Field.HelpDefault: Assign topics to this page. These topics can be used to create links to similar information on your site, and to gather statistics about the habits of users on your site.

Field.Name: PageTitle
Field.Caption: Page Title
Field.HelpDefault: Enter a page title for this page. Added only if no title was added by the content on this page. If blank, the page name is added. It will be added to the html title field which is often displayed in the browser tab. Search Engines and Social Media may use this field as the name of the page.

Field.Name: ImageFilename
Field.Caption: Image
Field.HelpDefault: Upload an image that represents the content for this page. Social Media may use this image.

Field.Name: MetaDescription
Field.Caption: Meta Description
Field.HelpDefault: Enter a description for this page. Added only if no description was added by the content on this page. Search engines and social media may use this descripton.

Field.Name: MetaKeywordList
Field.Caption: Meta Keyword List
Field.HelpDefault: Enter a list of short keywords that represent this content. This field may be used to index your content by Search Engines.

Field.Name: OtherHeadTags
Field.Caption: Other Head Tags
Field.HelpDefault: Optionally enter any html code you wish to appear in the document HEAD for the page that includes this content.

Field.Name: Viewings
Field.Caption: deprecated (Page Views)
Field.HelpDefault: The number of public views this page has had.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this Text Message. The name is not visible to the public.

Field.Name: Body
Field.Caption: Body
Field.HelpDefault: The message that will be sent.

Field.Name: TestMemberID
Field.Caption: Send Confirmation To
Field.HelpDefault: Select a user to receive the tests and the confirmation after texts are sent.

Field.Name: ScheduleDate
Field.Caption: Do not send Before
Field.HelpDefault: The message will not be automatically sent before this date.

Field.Name: expireDate
Field.Caption: Do not send after
Field.HelpDefault: The message will not be automatically send after this date.

Field.Name: LastSendTestDate
Field.Caption: Last Send Test
Field.HelpDefault: The date and time when the text message was last tested.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this Text Message. The name is not visible to the public.

Field.Name: Body
Field.Caption: Body
Field.HelpDefault: The message that will be sent.

Field.Name: TestMemberID
Field.Caption: Send Confirmation To
Field.HelpDefault: Select a user to receive the tests and the confirmation after texts are sent.

Field.Name: Submitted
Field.Caption: Submitted
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this message has been submitted to be sent.

Field.Name: Sent
Field.Caption: Sent
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this message has been sent.

Field.Name: LastSendTestDate
Field.Caption: Last Send Test
Field.HelpDefault: The date and time when the text message was last tested.

Field.Name: SendStatus
Field.Caption: Send Status
Field.HelpDefault: OK if successful, else the reason for the failure.

Field.Name: SystemTextMessageID
Field.Caption: System Text Message
Field.HelpDefault: If set, this log entry if from a system text.

Field.Name: GroupTextMessageID
Field.Caption: Group Text Message
Field.HelpDefault: If set, this log entry if from a group text.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this email. The name is not visible to the public.

Field.Name: Subject
Field.Caption: Subject Line
Field.HelpDefault: The subject line of the email.

Field.Name: FromAddress
Field.Caption: From Address
Field.HelpDefault: The email from-address. If using the Amazon SES email service this email address needs to be pre-approved or the email will not be sent.

Field.Name: TestMemberID
Field.Caption: Send Confirmation To
Field.HelpDefault: Select a user from Site Managers to receive the test email and the confirmation email sent after emails are sent.

Field.Name: EmailTemplateID
Field.Caption: Email Template
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) Select an email template to be merged into this email. When merged, this email is placed in the template in the spot marked with the Content-Box addon.

Field.Name: CopyFilename
Field.Caption: Body
Field.HelpDefault: The body of the email.

Field.Name: ConditionID
Field.Caption: Condition
Field.LookupList: Condition period (days) before expiration from Condition Groups,Condition period (days) after joining Condition Groups
Field.HelpDefault: For conditional email, select which condition causes the email to send.

Field.Name: ConditionPeriod
Field.Caption: Condition Period
Field.HelpDefault: The number of days used as the period for the Condition.

Field.Name: ScheduleDate
Field.Caption: Do not send Before
Field.HelpDefault: The email will not be automatically sent before this date.

Field.Name: ConditionExpireDate
Field.Caption: Do not send after
Field.HelpDefault: The email will not be automatically send after this date.

Field.Name: AddLinkEID
Field.Caption: Allow Link Authentication
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, links in the email will include a code that automatically logs the user in as the user account with the email to-address. NOTE: This means anyone with this email can log into the site. By default, this setting is false.

Field.Name: Submitted
Field.Caption: Submitted
Field.HelpDefault: For conditional and group emails, this checkbox means the email will be sent.

Field.Name: Sent
Field.Caption: Sent
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this email has been sent.

Field.Name: LastSendTestDate
Field.Caption: Last Send Test
Field.HelpDefault: The date and time when the email was last tested.

Field.Name: lastProcessDate
Field.Caption: Last Background Process Run
Field.HelpDefault: The time and date when the background email process last ran

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Installs with Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: addonList
Field.Caption: Add-on List
Field.HelpDefault: Developer Only: This field contains a JSON string that outlines the structure of the content. Use the Page Builder mode on the Tool Panel at the top of the public page to create and edit this feature.

Field.Name: personalizeAddonId
Field.Caption: Personalization Addon
Field.HelpDefault: When this email is sent to each recipient, this addon will be executed and should return a list of replacements compatible with the Mustache-Templating standard.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this template. Templates are used to create the 'shell' of an email design that contains no content. A template should always contain a location where the email text will be inserted, called the 'Content Box', and is formated like this - {% "content box" %}. When an email is sent, if it has a template selected, the email content will be added to this template and sent.

Field.Name: BodyHTML
Field.Caption: Body
Field.HelpDefault: The HTML document used as the email template. The email content will by placed in the {% "content box" %}

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Installs with Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: EmailTypeID
Field.Caption: Email Type
Field.LookupList: Conditional Birthday,Conditional After Join,Conditional Before Expiration,System,Group

Field.Name: sendingProcessKey
Field.Caption: Sending Process Key
Field.HelpDefault: The key from the sending process that is assigned to this entry. A record is assigned to a key for a period, defined by the expiration. Only this process can send the record, and only for that period.

Field.Name: sendingProcessExpiration
Field.Caption: Sending Process Expiration
Field.HelpDefault: The expiration of sending process key assigned to this entry. A record is assigned to a key for a period, defined by the expiration. Only this process can send the record, and only for that period.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The email address that was reported in the issue, as it was reported.

Field.Name: email
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The simple email address processed from the reported email.

Field.Name: details
Field.Caption: Details
Field.HelpDefault: The details of the email issue reported by the destination server.

Field.Name: transient
Field.Caption: Transient
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this entry represents an email failure that may be recoverable. If possible to correct, please attempt to correct the problem and delete this entry. if the problem is not corrected by the Transient Fix Deadline, any future email failures will change this entry to a permanent failure.

Field.Name: transientFixDeadline
Field.Caption: Transient Fix Deadline
Field.HelpDefault: if this is a transient failure, this is the deadline to fix the problem. If it is not fixed, the next failure will change this entry to a permanent failure.

Field.Name: toPhone
Field.Caption: To Phone
Field.HelpDefault: The phone number

Field.Name: immediate
Field.Caption: Immediate
Field.HelpDefault: If true, prioritize to the front of the list.

Field.Name: attempts
Field.Caption: Attempts
Field.HelpDefault: How many times has this send been attempted.

Field.Name: content
Field.Caption: Content
Field.HelpDefault: The message body

Field.Name: sendSerialNumber
Field.Caption: send Serial Number
Field.HelpDefault: Set during the send process. Records with this value set likely failed during send. This field is reset after a short period based on the modifiedDate field.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The bulleted headline for this See Also entry.

Field.Name: Link
Field.Caption: Link
Field.HelpDefault: If included, the headline will be linked to this url.

Field.Name: Brief
Field.Caption: Brief
Field.HelpDefault: If included, this text will appear as a normal paragraph after linked headline.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of the country.

Field.Name: Abbreviation
Field.Caption: Abbreviation
Field.HelpDefault: The typical abbreviation for this country. Used for services that require abbreviation.

Field.Name: DomesticShipping
Field.Caption: Domestic Shipping
Field.HelpDefault: If true, domestic shipping applies to this country.

Field.Name: SortOrder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: Can be used by addons to custom sort countries.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of this property.

Field.Name: TypeID
Field.Caption: TypeID
Field.HelpDefault: The type of property. See PropertyTypeEnum. 0=user, 1=visit, 2=visitor.

Field.Name: KeyID
Field.Caption: KeyID
Field.HelpDefault: The id of the ccmembers, ccvisits, or ccvisitor table that represents this user, visit or visitor.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The category name

Field.Name: IconHtml
Field.Caption: Icon Html
Field.HelpDefault: Enter html to be used for the add-on category's icon. We recommend 60px by 60px. The image can be a single image, or a vertical set of images treated as a sprite with images for normal, over, active, disabled. ex <div class="iconContentDefault"><i class="fas fa-cogs"></i></div>

Field.Name: SortOrder
Field.Caption: Alpha Sort Order
Field.HelpDefault: If the content is set to sort by Alpha Sort Order, this is the field used to alpha sort.

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of this add-on. For add-ons marked as remote methods, this becomes the path in the url. See /help/Contensive/Remote_Methods for more details. For all other add-ons (design blocks used in content, tasks run in the background, events, etc) the name has no functional role and can be changed anytime.

Field.Name: CollectionID
Field.Caption: Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: contentSourceId
Field.Caption: Return Content From
Field.LookupList: All,Content Text,Content Wysiwyg,Remote Asset,Form Execution,Scripting Code Execution,DotNet Code Execution
Field.HelpDefault: Select the part of this add-on that will be returned when the system executes the add-on. This is typically set to include all content. All content is delivered in this order: ContentText + ContentWysiwyg + RemoteAsset + FormExecution + ScriptingCodeExecution + DotNetCodeExecution. You may however set this to one and the add-on will only return the selected data source.

Field.Name: DotNetClass
Field.Caption: DotNet Namespace.Class
Field.HelpDefault: Include the namespace and class of a Dot Net windows class that inherits CPBaseClass found in Nuget package Contensive.CPBaseClasses and the class's .Execute() method will be called and it's return string will be returned by this add-on.

Field.Name: ScriptingCode
Field.Caption: Script Code
Field.HelpDefault: Add script code in javascript or Microsoft VBS and the first method (function) will be run and it's return string added to the output of this add-on.

Field.Name: ScriptingTimeout
Field.Caption: Script Timeout for Script (msec)
Field.HelpDefault: Use to extend the time allowed for script code to run.

Field.Name: ScriptingLanguageID
Field.Caption: Script Language
Field.HelpDefault: Select the language for Script Code.

Field.Name: ScriptingEntryPoint
Field.Caption: Script Procedure to Run
Field.HelpDefault: The system will attempt to run the first method found in the Script Code. To run a different method enter it here. For javascript enter the method name followed by open/close parentheses, like "myMethod()". For VBS, enter just the method name, like "myMethod".

Field.Name: CopyText
Field.Caption: Content Text
Field.HelpDefault: Enter text that will be return by the add-on as-ins.

Field.Name: Copy
Field.Caption: Content Wysiwyg
Field.HelpDefault: Enter text that will be return by the add-on as html formatted text.

Field.Name: IncludedAddons
Field.Caption: Dependencies
Field.HelpDefault: Check add-ons that must be run before this add-on is run. If the add-on has already executed during the durrent document it is not re-run.

Field.Name: Events
Field.Caption: Events To Handle
Field.HelpDefault: If other add-ons call cp.Site.ThrowEvent() and this add-on has checked the event in this list, this add-on will be called.

Field.Name: ArgumentList
Field.Caption: Argument List
Field.HelpDefault: The argument list is a set of name=value pairs seperated by new line. When addons are added to a page with the wysiwyg editor, the administrator will have a tool to edit the values for these arguments. The name=value pairs are provided to code through the cp.doc properties, and the content is find-replaced with $name$.

Field.Name: instanceSettingPrimaryContentId
Field.Caption: Instance Setting Primary Content
Field.HelpDefault: If this addon is added to pages or templates and has a primary settings record associated to the instanceId, select the content for that instance. This selection enables the edit link for Page Builder.

Field.Name: AliasList
Field.Caption: Alias List
Field.HelpDefault: Comma delimited list of alternative names for this addon. Use this list when changing the name of an addon but the original name may be in use. Calling any of these names will invoke the addon, but these names will not appear when adding addons into content.

Field.Name: IsInline
Field.Caption: Is Inline HTML Element
Field.HelpDefault: Check if this addon generates an html inline tag, like a person's anem. When checked, this addon will be represented with a small inline icon.

Field.Name: Link
Field.Caption: Javascript Callback Link
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated (For html only. Enter a url that will be added to the a script tag in the returned string. All document settings will be added to the query string.)

Field.Name: RemoteAssetLink
Field.Caption: Remote Asset Link
Field.HelpDefault: Provide a URL and the addon will insert the content returned from that URL.

Field.Name: FormXML
Field.Caption: Form Constructor XML
Field.HelpDefault: For Html content only. Enter an xml document that describes the form required. Typically used for settings pages. See contensive.io/docs for details.

Field.Name: javascriptForceHead
Field.Caption: Javascript In Head
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, javascript references created here will be forced into the head tag instead of at the end of the body. Note that if this add-on has any dependencies, their javascript references will also be forced into the head.

Field.Name: JSHeadScriptSrc
Field.Caption: Javacript Src - Default
Field.HelpDefault: Enter the url of a 3rd party library script and it will be added at the document if 'Javacript Src - Html Platform 5' is blank, or Html Platform Version is not set to 5. Html Platform Version is a site property that coordinates the use of external libraries like bootstrap 4 and 5.

Field.Name: JSHeadScriptPlatform5Src
Field.Caption: Javacript Src - Html Platform 5
Field.HelpDefault: Enter the url of a 3rd party library script and it will be added at the document if Html Platform Version is not set to 5. This field will be used instead of 'Javacript Src - Default'. Html Platform Version is a site property that coordinates the use of external libraries like bootstrap 4 and 5.

Field.Name: JSFilename
Field.Caption: Javascript
Field.HelpDefault: Enter javascript directly to be used for this addon. The Javascript-Src field and the Javascript field can be used together.

Field.Name: MinifyJSFilename
Field.Caption: Minified Javacript
Field.HelpDefault: This field is automatically created from Javascript on save. If present, this is delivered by the site instead of the Javascript field. To enable or disable automatic style and js minification, set the site property 'Allow Addon JS and CSS Minify' to true or false.

Field.Name: PageTitle
Field.Caption: Page Title
Field.HelpDefault: For Html only. Text entered here will be added to the html document's title tag.

Field.Name: MetaDescription
Field.Caption: Meta Description
Field.HelpDefault: For Html only. Text entered here will be added to the html document's meta description tag.

Field.Name: MetaKeywordList
Field.Caption: Meta Keyword List
Field.HelpDefault: For Html only. Text entered here will be added to the html document's meta keyword list.

Field.Name: OtherHeadTags
Field.Caption: Other Head Tags
Field.HelpDefault: For Html only. Enter valid html tags that will be added to the html document's head after all other meta tags.

Field.Name: RobotsTxt
Field.Caption: Append to Robots.txt
Field.HelpDefault: Enter a valid robot.txt text line and it will be added to the intercepted robots.txt file.

Field.Name: Admin
Field.Caption: On Admin Navigator
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon appears on the admin navigator to administrators. It can be executed and the results are displayed on the admin desktop.

Field.Name: Content
Field.Caption: Add to Pages
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon can be added from the Page Builder public site tool, and from the wysiwyg editor when editing page content.

Field.Name: Template
Field.Caption: Add to Templates
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon can be added from the wysiwyg editor when editing page templates.

Field.Name: Email
Field.Caption: Add to Emails
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon can be added from the wysiwyg editor when editing email. The addon will be run in a context with the email recipient as the user.

Field.Name: OnBodyEnd
Field.Caption: Body End - Before </Body> Tag
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be executed on html pages when the content of the body tag is complete, and the output will be included before the end-body tag.

Field.Name: OnPageStartEvent
Field.Caption: Before Content Box
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be executed on html pages and its output added to the start of the content box.

Field.Name: RemoteMethod
Field.Caption: Is Remote Method
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be executed from a route in the url matching its name.

Field.Name: Filter
Field.Caption: After Body
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be on html pages executed after the complete document is produced. It can be used to filter the resulting document by reading and updating cp.doc.body

Field.Name: OnBodyStart
Field.Caption: Body Start - After <Body> Tag
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon is executed on html pages right before the content is rendered and its output is included right after the body tag.

Field.Name: fieldTypeEditor
Field.Caption: Use as Editor for Field Types
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be used as an editor (like a text box or checkbox) within the admin edit site. It must also be selected in the Content Field Types as an editing option.

Field.Name: OnPageEndEvent
Field.Caption: After Content Box
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be executed on html pages and its output added to the end of the content box.

Field.Name: htmlDocument
Field.Caption: Html Document
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, the output of this addon is considered an Html Document. When run from executeAddon() and executeRoute() it will deliver its output inside the body tag of an html document created during its execute. The admin site and the page manager are examples of Html Document addons.

Field.Name: diagnostic
Field.Caption: Diagnostic
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, this addon will be considerd a diagnostic add-on and executed by diagnostic processes. A diagnostic addon should return a text (non-html) string with the first two characters 'OK' if successful. Programmatic calls will ignore additional characters. Additional text may help manual processes diagnose issues. For example, the built-in /status add-on executes all diagnostic addons and reports ERROR if all do not return OK.

Field.Name: NavTypeID
Field.Caption: Navigation Type
Field.HelpDefault: Select the appropriate presentation for this add-on on the admin navigator. A link to this addon will included in the appropriate section.

Field.Name: AddonCategoryId
Field.Caption: Navigation Category
Field.HelpDefault: Select the appropriate category that helps the content manager locate this addon.

Field.Name: BlockEditTools
Field.Caption: Block Advanced Edit Tools
Field.HelpDefault: When not checked, if this add-on is used as a design block, administrators can edit it when advanced edit is selected.

Field.Name: IconHtml
Field.Caption: Icon Html
Field.HelpDefault: Enter html to be used for the add-on's icon. We recommend 60px by 60px. The image can be a single image, or a vertical set of images treated as a sprite with images for normal, over, active, disabled. ex <div class="iconAddonDefault"><i class="fas fa-puzzle-piece"></i></div>

Field.Name: EditPlaceholderHtml
Field.Caption: Edit Placeholder Html
Field.HelpDefault: Enter html to be used within PageBuilder to represent this add-on's rendered content. Use this field when the add-on's rendered content is not appropriate for Page Builder

Field.Name: IconFilename
Field.Caption: Icon Image URL (img src value)
Field.HelpDefault: If Icon Html is blank, enter a url to an image used for the add-on's icon. We recommend 60px by 60px. The image can be a single image, or a vertical set of images treated as a sprite with images for normal, over, active, disabled.

Field.Name: IconHeight
Field.Caption: Icon Height
Field.HelpDefault: The icon height. If a numeric value is entered 'px' is assumed. 50 is recommended.

Field.Name: IconWidth
Field.Caption: Icon Width
Field.HelpDefault: The icon width. If a numeric value is entered 'px' is assumed. 50 is recommended.

Field.Name: IconSprites
Field.Caption: Icon Sprites
Field.HelpDefault: If the icon is a sprint, enter the number of sprint images supported. They will be used as normal, over, active, disabled.

Field.Name: ProcessInterval
Field.Caption: Minutes Between Execution
Field.HelpDefault: If not 0, the add-on will be periodically executed by the Task Scheduler process in the background.

Field.Name: ProcessRunOnce
Field.Caption: Execute Once Now
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this add-on will be executed once during the next Task Scheduler/Task Runner cycle, which occurs every 10 seconds.

Field.Name: ProcessNextRun
Field.Caption: Next Execution
Field.HelpDefault: The add-on will be run next at this date-time. This field is automatically set by the task scheduler service if minutes-between-execute is not null.

Field.Name: ProcessTimeout
Field.Caption: Process Timeout (seconds)
Field.HelpDefault: If not 0, the time in seconds allowed for this addon to execute as a process in the background. Leave blank or 0 to run without a timeout.

Field.Name: ProcessContentTriggers
Field.Caption: Trigger on Content Change
Field.HelpDefault: Check any content (database table) and this add-on will executed when this content is updated in the admin site.

Field.Name: StylesLinkHref
Field.Caption: Stylesheet Url - Default
Field.HelpDefault: Enter the url to a stylesheet and it will be added to the style section of the html document's head tag. Add it to the Html Platform 5 field and it will be used if Html Platform Version is set to 5. Add to the Default field and it will be used if Html Plaform is not set to 5 or if the Html Platform 5 field is empty. Html Platform Version is a site property that coordinates the use of external libraries like bootstrap 4 and 5.

Field.Name: StylesLinkPlatform5Href
Field.Caption: Stylesheet Url - Html Platform 5
Field.HelpDefault: Enter the url to a stylesheet and it will be added to the style section of the html document's head tag. Add it to the Html Platform 5 field and it will be used if Html Platform Version is set to 5. Add to the Default field and it will be used if Html Plaform is not set to 5 or if the Html Platform 5 field is empty. Html Platform Version is a site property that coordinates the use of external libraries like bootstrap 4 and 5.

Field.Name: StylesFilename
Field.Caption: Styles
Field.HelpDefault: Enter individual styles and a stylesheet will be created for the html document and a link to it will be added to the html document's head tag.

Field.Name: MinifyStylesFilename
Field.Caption: Minified Styles
Field.HelpDefault: This field is automatically created from Styles on save. To enable or disable automatic style and js minification, set the site property 'Allow Addon JS and CSS Minify' to true or false.

Field.Name: JavaScriptOnLoad
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated.

Field.Name: OnNewVisitEvent
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated.

Field.Name: BlockDefaultStyles
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated.

Field.Name: CustomStylesFilename
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated.

Field.Name: ObjectProgramID
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: Legacy. Do not use this field. The content in this field is used by developers to upgrade old components.

Field.Name: CollectionID
Field.Caption: Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name of this add-on collection. It is not seen on the public site. It is used for the admin navigator and for the reou

Field.Name: System
Field.Caption: System Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this collection is used by the system and has no features available to the content manager.

Field.Name: Updatable
Field.Caption: Updatable Collection
Field.HelpDefault: if checked, this collection can be updated. If not checked, an upload or re-installation of this collection will fail. Use for collections that contain editable content.

Field.Name: blockNavigatorNode
Field.Caption: Block Navigator Node
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, the admin navigator will not show this collection

Field.Name: helpLink
Field.Caption: Online Help
Field.HelpDefault: If not blank, the navigator will include this link as the help link

Field.Name: Help
Field.Caption: Help
Field.HelpDefault: To Deprecate

Field.Name: LastChangeDate
Field.Caption: Last Change Date
Field.HelpDefault: The last date this collection was installed. Used internally for automatic updates.

Field.Name: ChildCollections
Field.Caption: Required Collections
Field.HelpDefault: Collections that must be installed before this collection can be installed.

Field.Name: ContentDefinitions
Field.Caption: Content Definitions
Field.HelpDefault: Content that is included when the collection is exported.

Field.Name: OtherXML
Field.Caption: Other XML
Field.HelpDefault: To Deprecate

Field.Name: wwwFileList
Field.Caption: www File List
Field.HelpDefault: To be deprecated. List of files included in the collection zip that are copied to the www folder. Install files in cdn files if they are public and private files if they are not.

Field.Name: ContentFileList
Field.Caption: Cdn File List
Field.HelpDefault: List of files in the collection zip file to be installed in the cdn file source.

Field.Name: ExecFileList
Field.Caption: Executable File List
Field.HelpDefault: List of files to be stored as executable files, typically DLL assembly files.

Field.Name: DataRecordList
Field.Caption: Data Record List (ContentName, NameOrGuid)
Field.HelpDefault: A list of records exported and installed with the collection

Field.Name: Events
Field.Caption: Events Thrown
Field.HelpDefault: A list of events installed with this collection. For example, an ecommerce collection might install an event like 'On Invoice Payment'. One or more addons in this collection would likely throw the event and addons in this or other collections might handle the event.

Field.Name: OnInstallAddonId
Field.Caption: Run After Installation
Field.HelpDefault: If selected, this addon will be run when this collection has been installed.

Field.Name: InstallFile
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: deprecated

Field.Name: ScriptingModules
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: deprecated

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: Name of the folder.

Field.Name: Description
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: Brief description of the folder.

Field.Name: ParentID
Field.Caption: Parent Folder
Field.HelpDefault: If empty, this is a root folder.

Field.Name: FolderID
Field.Caption: Folder
Field.HelpDefault: The folder associated to this permission. Users in this group will have access to this folder.

Field.Name: GroupID
Field.Caption: Group
Field.HelpDefault: The group associated to this permission. Users in this group will have access to this folder.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: A name for this file to identify it. It can be the filename, but can also be a short phrase you use to recognize the file. In some cases, software uses this name to find the file.

Field.Name: Description
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: A short description for the file. This description may be used to describe the file in file manager.

Field.Name: Filename
Field.Caption: Filename
Field.HelpDefault: A link to the actual file stored in the CDN file storage.

Field.Name: FileSize
Field.Caption: Size
Field.HelpDefault: The size of the file

Field.Name: FolderID
Field.Caption: Folder
Field.HelpDefault: A virtual folder in the Resource Library where this file can be found.

Field.Name: Clicks
Field.Caption: Clicks
Field.HelpDefault: The number of times this file was downloaded.

Field.Name: Width
Field.Caption: Image Width
Field.HelpDefault: If the file is an image, this is the width of the image as it was uploaded. Other sizes may be avaialble in the alternate size list.

Field.Name: Height
Field.Caption: Image Height
Field.HelpDefault: If the file is an image, this is the height of the image as it was uploaded. Other sizes may be avaialble in the alternate size list.

Field.Name: AltSizeList
Field.Caption: Alternate Size List
Field.HelpDefault: This list is used by the system to trace resize and cropped versions

Field.Name: Spidered
Field.Caption: Spidered
Field.HelpDefault: If unchecked, this means this link alias has not been spidered and is out of date

Field.Name: DateSpidered
Field.Caption: Date Spidered
Field.HelpDefault: This is the date when this link was last spidered

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The exact domain name for these settings.

Field.Name: TypeID
Field.Caption: Type
Field.LookupList: Normal,Forward to URL,Forward to Replacement Domain
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) Set Forward-To-Url and hits to this domain will be forwarded to the url, to this or another site. Set to Forward-to-Replacement-Domain and hits will be forwarded to the replacement domain and the same page on this website. Leave blank or set to Normal and the site will render with this domain.

Field.Name: defaultRouteId
Field.Caption: Default Route
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) If the route (path and page) do not match an valid addon or the admin route, this addon will be executed. If blank the Page Manager addon will be executed. Page Manager creates a website.

Field.Name: RootPageID
Field.Caption: Landing Page
Field.HelpDefault: If set to Normal and the url is just the domain, this page will be displayed. Use this to set the home page for the site.

Field.Name: DefaultTemplateId
Field.Caption: Default Template
Field.HelpDefault: If set to Normal and not template can be determined for page, this template will be used. Templates are determined first by the page, then parent pages, then this domain, then the site property in Preferences.

Field.Name: forwardDomainId
Field.Caption: Replacement Domain
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) If the domain type is Forward-To-Replacement-Domain, this is the domain that the user will be forwarded to.

Field.Name: ForwardURL
Field.Caption: Forward URL
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) If the domain is set to Forward-to-Url, this is the url that the user will be forwarded to.

Field.Name: NoFollow
Field.Caption: Block Spiders with No-Follow
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, all website hits to this domain will include meta data to prevent search engine spiders from following links on this page.

Field.Name: Visited
Field.Caption: Has Been Visited
Field.HelpDefault: If checked, this domain has been visited.

Field.Name: PageNotFoundPageID
Field.Caption: Page not Found Page
Field.HelpDefault: (optional) If set to Normal and no route or page is found, this page will be displayed.

Field.Name: allowCORS
Field.Caption: Deprecated (Include Default CORS Headers)
Field.HelpDefault: When checked, requests from this domain will respond with default CORS headers allowing this origin.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this record.

Field.Name: BodyHTML
Field.Caption: Body
Field.HelpDefault: If this template is selected for a page or a domain the page content will by placed in the {% "content box" %} if this template.

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Installs with Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: mustacheDataSetAddonId
Field.Caption: Mustache Rendering Dataset
Field.HelpDefault: Templates may contain mustache elements (see mustache.github.io). If so, create an addon that returns the dataset needed to render the mustache properties, and select it here.

Field.Name: IsSecure
Field.Caption: deprected
Field.HelpDefault: Deprecated. protocol controlled by webserver.

Field.Name: timeout
Field.Caption: Timeout (minutes)
Field.HelpDefault: If not 0 or blank, the time in secdonds allowed for this process in the background. Leave blank or 0 to run without a timeout.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: A brief summary of the activity's type,status,user,assignment to be shown in a list of other activities. Typically 'Call', 'Message', 'Meeting', 'Online Form', etc.

Field.name: MemberID
Field.caption: Activity Contact
Field.HelpDefault: The user who the event affects. In the CRM, this is the lead/customer whose page this activity apears. The user who received the email.

Field.name: typeId
Field.caption: Type
Field.lookuplist: Online Visit,Online Purchase,Email Sent,Email Received,Call,Call From,Text Msg,Text Msg From,Online Meeting,In-Person Meeting,Contact Update
Field.HelpDefault: The type of activity. For example a scheduled meeting or a visit online from the lead.

Field.name: Message
Field.caption: Details
Field.HelpDefault: A plain Text description of the activity.

Field.name: scheduledStaffId
Field.caption: Staff Contact
Field.HelpDefault: The staff user involved with this activity. To include a user in this list, add

Field.Name: dateScheduled
Field.Caption: Activity Date
Field.HelpDefault: If this activity is a scheduled event, this is the scheduled start of the event. For non-scheudled events this is when the event took place. If empty, the Date Added is when the event took place.

Field.Name: dateCompleted
Field.Caption: Date Completed
Field.HelpDefault: If this activity is a scheduled event, this is when the activity was completed. If empty the activity has not been completed.

Field.Name: dateCanceled
Field.Caption: Date Canceled
Field.HelpDefault: If this activity is a scheduled event, this is when the activity was canceled.

Field.Name: Link
Field.Caption: Link to Event
Field.HelpDefault: The optional url of the event (video meeting, etc)

Field.Name: VisitorID
Field.Caption: Visitor ID
Field.HelpDefault: For Tracking only. The visitor in which the event occured

Field.Name: VisitID
Field.Caption: Visit ID
Field.HelpDefault: For Tracking only. The visit session in which the event occured

Field.name: OrganizationID
Field.caption: (deprecated) Organization
Field.HelpDefault: The organization effected by the event. Typically the organization of the user at the time the event occurs.

Field.Name: Layout
Field.Caption: Default Layout
Field.HelpDefault: The styles + html + Javascript used when the site is set to Html Platform version 4 (bootstrap 4 based designs) or the platform 5 layout is empty. The Html Platform version is a site property that coordinates resources like styles and layouts for each set of standards.

Field.Name: LayoutPlatform5
Field.Caption: Layout for Html Plaform 5
Field.HelpDefault: The styles + html + Javascript for this layout when the site is set to Html Platform version 5 (bootstrap 5 based designs). The Html Platform version is a site property that coordinates resources like styles and layouts for each set of standards.

Field.Name: InstalledByCollectionID
Field.Caption: Installed By Collection
Field.HelpDefault: The addon collection that installed this record.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Warning Type
Field.HelpDefault: A short description of the issue. For example "Bad link to /about-bad-link found on /home". If the issue recurs, this description should exactly match.

Field.Name: DateLastReported
Field.Caption: Date Last Reported
Field.HelpDefault: The time and date when the warning was added, or when the warning count was last incremented.

Field.Name: count
Field.Caption: Reported Count
Field.HelpDefault: If a site warning is added and the Warning Type and Description match a previous warning, the existing entry's count is incremented instead of adding a second warning.

Field.Name: description
Field.Caption: Description
Field.HelpDefault: A longer more detailed description with information that will make it easier for the user to solve the issue. Like "The link http://www.this.com/pagename was found on http://www.this.com/About-us and it was causes a 404 error on Feb 3 at 2pm."

Field.Name: Alarm
Field.Caption: Set Monitor Alarm (dev only)
Field.HelpDefault: When true, this site warning will cause the server monitor to alarm

Field.Name: generalKey
Field.Caption: Issue Category (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: A more general category of the warning, like "404 error". Can be used in reports to show generalized counts.

Field.Name: location
Field.Caption: Location (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: the URL, service or process that caused the problem. This is where the user will go to correct the issue. For example "http://goodpageThankHasBadLink.com", or "Addon 'Ecommerce Batch Process'

Field.Name: PageID
Field.Caption: Page (deprecated)
Field.HelpDefault: If the issue happened on a webpage, this is the page where is occurred.

Field.Name: specificKey
Field.Caption: deprecated, use name
Field.HelpDefault: A more specific warning with a detail related to this issue, but still generic enough that if the error occurs mulitple times, the general and specific keys will match so the count can be incremented.

Field.Name: shortDescription
Field.Caption: deprecated, use name
Field.HelpDefault: A short description of the issue (under 255 characters) that should match exactly if the issue occurs more than once. For example "bad link http://thisisabadlink.com"

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Installs with Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: Name
Field.Caption: Name
Field.HelpDefault: The name for this record. The name is generally used to identify the record in a list, and is often used as a caption when the record is displayed publicly

Field.Name: pagesIncludedManyToMany
Field.Caption: Pages Included
Field.HelpDefault: Optional. If any menus are checked, this page will appear as a root page on the menu. This will not effect how the page appears as a child page of its parent pages.

Field.Name: collectionId
Field.Caption: Installs with Collection
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: CollectionID
Field.Caption: deprecated
Field.HelpDefault: If a collection is selected, this record was added by the installation of this collection, and if the collection is reinstalled the data will be overwritten. To customize this data, make a copy of this record and use the copy.

Field.Name: InstalledByCollectionID
Field.Caption: Installed By Collection
Field.HelpDefault: The addon collection that installed this record.

Field.Name: userid
Field.Caption: user id
Field.HelpDefault: User who click this recently

Field.Name: href
Field.Caption: Href
Field.HelpDefault: Recent admin hits for addons and data

Field.Name: memberid
Field.Caption: User
Field.HelpDefault: The user that used this password.

Field.Name: success
Field.Caption: Success
Field.HelpDefault: checked if this login was successful.

Field.Name: memberid
Field.Caption: User
Field.HelpDefault: The user that used this password.

Addon.name: Site Settings
Addon.FormXML: <Form> <Description>Settings that affect the general appearance and function of Contensive features on the site</Description> <Help>Help Copy</Help> <HelpLink>http://www.contensive.com</HelpLink> <Tab name="Admin" heading="Administration Site Settings" description="Settings that affect the layout and design of the Administration site"> <SiteProperty caption="Admin Route Addon" name="ADMINROOTADDONID" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="[None:0|listid(Add-ons)]" Description="Select an addon to run when the admin route is requested."/> <SiteProperty caption="Header" name="ADMINHEADERHTML" ReadOnly="0" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="This caption appears in the upper left corner of the banner over the administration page">Contensive Administration</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Missing Field Check" name="ALLOWADMINFIELDCHECK" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="This feature tests all form responses for missing fields. Clear this checkbox if a 'missing field error' prevents you from submitting a form."/> <SiteProperty caption="HTML Editor Height (px)" name="DefaultFormInputHTMLHeight" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The height of the HTML editor">250</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Text Editor Height (lines)" name="DefaultFormInputTextHeight" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The height of a text block editor">1</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Input Form Width (characters)" name="DefaultFormInputWidth" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The width of form input elements, including text, numeric, date, etc.">60</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Select Field Length Limit (rows)" name="SelectFieldLimit" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The maximum length allowed for a select drop-down field. If this limit is exceeded, an error is generated. If drop-down fields are allowed to grow large, the site performance will be effected.">4000</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Select Field Width Limit (characters)" name="SelectFieldWidthLimit" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="The maximum width of the displayable text in a drop-down select field. If a caption is too large, it is truncated.">100</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Editing Lock Time (minutes)" name="EDITLOCKTIMEOUT" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Description="When a record is being edited, it is locked so others can not save over the changes you make. This is the time, in minutes that the system waits for the editor to save or cancel the changes.">5</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="App" heading="Application Settings" description="Settings that affect the entire application."> <SiteProperty caption="Database Upgrade Level" name="BuildVersion" ReadOnly="1" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="This is the version of your data, not the version of the Contensive software on your server.
