If this version number is lower then the software version, your may need to run a software upgrade."></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Email" heading="Email Settings" description="Settings that affect how Contensive sends email."> <SiteProperty caption="Admin Email Address" name="EmailAdmin" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The email address that will be used when the system emails the administrator."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Default Email From Address" name="EmailFromAddress" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The from-address used when emails are sent without a correct from-address. This address is also used when the to-address equals the from-address on a valid email to prevent the email from being stopped by spam services."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Web Address (Protocol + domain name) for URLs to the Server" name="webAddressProtocolDomain" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="Optional. The protocol plus domain name used to alter the URL of resourcesin html when the html will be accessed outside of the website, like for email and RSS feeds. For example if a group email includes an image like helloWorld.png in the /img folder, the email editor will link to the image with a url like '/img/helloWorld.png'.To make this url work for email, it must have the form 'https://www.MySite.com/img/helloWorld.png' . In this case, this field would be populated with 'https://www.MySite.com'. If empty, the primary domain and secure protocol will be used."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Send without Test" name="AllowEmailSendWithoutTest" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When selected, you can send an email without first testing it. When not selected, you must perform a 'send test' before the send button is activated."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Last Email Background Operation" name="EmailServiceLastCheck" ReadOnly="true" Type="text" Selector="" Description="Most email operations occur in the background. This is the time when the last operation occurred. If this time and date is more then a minutes old, there may be a problem processing email."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Use AWS Simple Email Service (SES)" name="AWS Use Amazon SES" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked and the AWS Security Key and Secret Key are entered, the system will send with Amazon SES. Otherwise it will use SMTP.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="SMTP Mail Server" name="SMTPServer" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The domain name of the SMTP mail server that this site should use when it sends email."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Bounce Address (SMTP Only)" name="EmailBounceAddress" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" Description="When the site sends an email, and there is a problem with delivery, it is returned to this email address. This email address is not visible in the email. If Email Bounce Processing is enabled, the site will fetch all email from this email address and process it appropriately."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Spam Footer" name="EMAILSPAMFOOTER" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This 255 character text string is included at the bottom of each email, giving the recipient a link to unsubscribe to email from this site. To designate the words to be linked, use &lt;link&gt; before the words and &lt;/link&gt; after the words. Only the first 255 characters will be used.">Click <link>unsubscribe</link> to unsubscribe from all email from this site.</SiteProperty> <CopyContent caption="Spam Footer Click Message" name="EmailSpamFooterClickMessage" ReadOnly="0" html="true" Description="This is the message a user will see when they click the Spam Footer link at the bottom of an email."><p style="text-align: center;"><br><br>You have blocked future emails from our site.</p></CopyContent> <!-- <SiteProperty caption="Allow Email Bounce Processing" name="AllowEmailBounceProcessing" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="Use email bound processing to automatically remove bad email addresses from your database. When enabled, the site will attempt to read all the email from the Email Bounce Address and remove them as instructed."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Bounce Processing Action" name="EMAILBOUNCEPROCESSACTION" ReadOnly="false" Type="integer" Selector="[Do nothing:0|Clear the Allow Group Email field for all matching addresses:1|Clear the email field for all matching addresses:2|Delete the user accounts for all matching addresses:3]" Description="Set the action to be performed when an Email address is identified as invalid by the bounce process."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Receive Server (POP)" name="POPServer" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This is the email server your site will use to receive email bounces, if configured."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Bounce Account Username" name="POPServerUsername" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If you choose to have the site process bounced emails, setup a bounce email address, and set the username of the email account here."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Email Bounce Account Password" name="POPServerPassword" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If you choose to have the site process bounced emails, setup a bounce email address, and set the password of the email account here."></SiteProperty> --> </Tab> <Tab name="Images" heading="Resource Handling Settings" description="Settings that affect how Contensive handles resources in the resource library."> <SiteProperty caption="User Default Avatar" name="avatarDefaultPathFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="ImageFile" Selector="" Description="The avatar for a user when no avatar is stored in their people record."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Image Resize" name="ImageAllowSFResize" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, images will be automatically resized if you manually change their size on a page. For instance, if you have a 100 pixel x 100 pixel image in the resource library, and you drop it on a page, and reduce it to only 50x50, Contensive will make another image sized to 50x50, and use that image on the page.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Image Update" name="ImageAllowUpdate" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, images that have been updated in the resource library will be automatically updated on the site as well.">true</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="IOT MQTT" heading="IOT MQTT Settings" description="Settings for managing IOT devices through MQTT."> <SiteProperty caption="MQTT Endpoint" name="mqtt endpoint" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The endpoint to the MQTT broker. This is just the domain-part of a url, with no protocol or ending-slash. For example, abc123.iot.us-east-1.amazonaws.com "></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="MQTT Broker Port" name="mqtt broker port" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The tcp/ip port number for the MQTT Broker. Typically 8883">8883</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="MQTT Certificate" name="mqtt certificate filename" ReadOnly="0" Type="PrivateFile" Selector="" Description="Upload the device certicate for this IOT device connection in pfx format. To convert pem files to pfx with password use 'openssl pkcs12 -export -in certificate.pem.crt -inkey private.pem.key -out certificate.cert.pfx -certfile AmazonRootCA1.pem -password pass:1234'"></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="MQTT Certificate Password" name="mqtt certificate password" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The password for the MQTT certificate."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="MQTT Root Certificate" name="mqtt root certificate filename" ReadOnly="0" Type="PrivateFile" Selector="" Description="Upload the root certicate for the broker."></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Security" heading="Security Settings" description="Settings that affect security and authentication"> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Email-As-Username" name="AllowEmailLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, users can login with their password and either their username or email address.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Password-less Login" name="AllowNoPasswordLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, non-content managers can login without a password. Be careful because this makes it easier for someone to guess someone else's login.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Auto Login" name="AllowAutoLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, returning users are automatically logged in to the site. Clear this setting if your site contains sections or pages blocked to only certain users, or if your site controls any private or personal information. If this feature is checked, administrations, developers and content managers should take care to always log-out after visiting the site from a public computer. ">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Auto Recognize" name="AllowAutoRecognize" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="This option is only avilable if Auto Login is disabled. When this option is checked, a returning visitor will not be authenticated, but personalization may still work correctly. Use this option if you can not use Auto Login, but want your visitors greeted with personlization.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Link Login" name="AllowLinkLogin" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, emails that contain links can be encoded so the reader is automatically logged in when the click from the email to the site. Like Link Recognition, this is a convenient feature, however, it posses a security risk and should not be used on sites with sensative material.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Link Recognize" name="AllowLinkRecognize" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, emails that contain links can be encoded so the reader is automatically recognized by the site when they click a link from the email. Recognized means the site log their visit and track them, but they will not be able to access special rights, like editing. This is a good tool to track email marketing conversion, and a convenient way to invite someone with being intrusive.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Password Recovery" name="AllowPasswordEmail" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, the login page includes a form for users to recover their email.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Public Registrations" name="AllowMemberJoin" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, the site registration Add-on is enabled, and the page block option for registration is enabled. A user can then register on your site. Registering means when they can select a username and password to login, and use this to login when they return. The registration form includes the option to join any group marked as public. If this feature is enabled, take care that all sensative groups, such as content manager groups, are NOT marked as public.">false</SiteProperty> <!-- username/password security settings --> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Plain Text Password" name="allow plain text password" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, the login process uses the ccmembers.password field, stored in plain text. When false, the process uses ccmembers.passwordHash, created by the change-password form, and the cp.user.setPassword() method.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Clear Plain-Text Password When Creating Hash, " name="clear admin password on hash" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled and plain-text password is disabled, if the password field is populated and passwordHash is blank, a failed login can attempt a plain-text password then populate passwordHash. Use this to migrate from plain-text to hash passwords.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Minimum Length" name="password min length" ReadOnly="0" Type="integer" Selector="" Description="The minimum length of a password.">10</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Requires Lowercase" name="password requires lowercase" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, new passwords added will require a lowercase character.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Requires Uppercase" name="password requires uppercase" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, new passwords added will require an uppercase character.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Requires Number" name="password requires number" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, new passwords added will require a number character.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Requires Special Character" name="password requires special character" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="If checked, new passwords added will require a special character.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Block Used Password Period" name="password block used password period" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="" Description="If not 0 or empty, do not let new users reuse passwords for this many days.">30</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Password Age Lockout Days" name="password age lockout days" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="" Description="If not 0 or empty, passwords must be updated if this many days old."></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Text Messages" heading="Text Message Settings (SMS)" description="When the system sends text messages through SMS, there are mulitple provides that can be used, and each provider has configuration settings. This tab sets up these configurations."> <SiteProperty caption="SMS Provider" name="SMS Provider Id" ReadOnly="0" Type="integer" Selector="[none:0|Twillio:1|AWS SNS:2]" Description="Select the Text Messaging provide to be used by the system. AWS permissions must be added to the site's AWS IAM credentials.">2</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Twillio Account SID" name="Twillio Account SID" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If Twillio is selected as the SMS provider, set your Twillio credentials here."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Twillio Auth Token" name="Twillio Auth Token" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If Twillio is selected as the SMS provider, set your Twillio credentials here."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Twillio Number" name="Twillio Number" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="If Twillio is selected as the SMS provider, set your Twillio credentials here."></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Tracking" heading="Activity Tracking" description="Settings that affect how the site tracks user and visitor activity"> <SiteProperty caption="Track Visits" name="AllowVisitTracking" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, the user and user sessioin visit information is automatically tracked. When disabled only authenticated visits are automatically tracked. Non-authenticated visits are tracked if any installed application references the user during execution.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="How many days to keep visit archives" name="ArchiveRecordAgeDays" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="" Description="Set the number of days you wish to keep old visit records. These records are used in reporting to detail the activity of every page hit. The default is 2.">2</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="How many days to keep guest archives" name="ArchivePeopleAgeDays" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="" Description="Set the number of days you wish to keep old guest records. Guests are people records that were created on the site, have no email address, have no username, and have only visited once. These records are used to recognize returning guests, but they can contribute to poor site performance by filling your 'people' content with unnecessary records. The default is 2.">2</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Delete visit records that do not support cookies" name="ArchiveDeleteNoCookie" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="Internet cookies are short text strings that your browser uses to recognize websites. Very few legitimate visitors do not support cookies. Search engine robots/spiders, however, typically do not support cookies. Deleting visit information for visitors that do not support cookies is an effective way of removing search engine robot information from your reports">1</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Archive Time-of-Day" name="ArchiveTimeOfDay" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="" Description="Small housekeeping activity occurs every minute and every hour, but longer running work is done onece a day at this time. Change this time to avoid server activity or other maintenance tasks like backup.">2:00:00 AM</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Website" heading="Website Settings" description="When used with a webserver, set the Page Manager add-on as the default route (The add-on that runs if the url does not match any other add-on). Page Manager creates a website. These settings control how Page Manager creates web pages."> <SiteProperty caption="Default Route" name="Default Route AddonId" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="[Select One:0|listid(add-ons)]" Description="For a typical application, this is the applications main addon. It is executed when no the request to the server does not specify any other command. For example, in the default application website, this is set to the Page Manager which creates an editable website."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Favicon" name="FaviconFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="ImageFile" Selector="" Description="This image is used as the icon for browsers and shortcuts."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Site Logo" name="SiteLogoFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="ImageFile" Selector="" Description="This is the primary logo file that appears by default where a logo is needed. For example in the Theme Header, or in the Station Device Thermal Printer command {{Logo}}"></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Robots.txt" name="RobotsTxtFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="TextFile" Selector="" Description="The Robots.txt file is a type of map used by Search engines to understand what physical pages and paths of the website they should be visiting, and should not be visiting. Since the pages of a Contensive website are virtual pages, not actual physical pages, the robots.txt file is less important. Use it to block the admin path. To block content from serach engines, use the blocking tab on the content page or section to block search engine robots. This uses a Meta tag instead.&lt;br&gt;User-agent: *&lt;br&gt;Disallow: /admin/&lt;br&gt;Disallow: /images/"></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="CSS/HTML bootstrap version" name="HTML PLATFORM VERSION" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="[Bootstrap-4:4|Bootstrap-5:5]" Description="Addons and layouts include content for the default styles (boostrap-4), and bootstrap-5.">5</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Minimize html" name="ALLOW HTML MINIFY" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, page manager html is automatically minimized. Debug mode disables minify">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Minimize addon css and javascript" name="ALLOW ADDON JS AND CSS MINIFY" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, addon css and js will be minimized and delivered for speed.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Auto HTML Formatting" name="AutoHTMLFormatting" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When enabled, the HTML assembled by Contensive is reflowed with tabs and linefeeds to be more human-readable.">&#187;</SiteProperty> <!-- use iis 404 error <SiteProperty caption="Page Not Found Content" name="PageNotFoundPageID" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="[Select One:0|listid(Page Content)]" Description="This is the content page that should be used when a requested page is not found. This includes incorrect URLs, as well as content pages that have been deleted."></SiteProperty> --> <CopyContent caption="Default Content Block Message" name="Content Block Copy" ReadOnly="0" html="true" Description="This is the default message used for any 'content blocked' page on the site. A content blocked page is one that is blocked by enabling blocking right on the page record. You can override this message on individual pages on the blocking tab of the page."><p>The content on this page has restricted access. If you have a username and password for this system, <a href="?method=login" rel="nofollow">Click Here</a>. For more information, please contact the administrator.</p></CopyContent> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Login Icon" name="AllowLoginIcon" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, a login icon will appear automatically in the lower right corner of the public site. Uncheck this box to remove the icon.">true</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Login Icon" name="LoginIconFilename" ReadOnly="0" Type="ImageFile" Selector="" Description="When Allow Login Icon is checked, this image will appear as a login link in the lower right corner of the public website. When clicked, this icon links to the login form."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Anonymous User Response" name="anonymousUserResponseID" ReadOnly="0" Type="Integer" Selector="[Allow Anonymouse Access:0|Block with Login Form:1|Block with Message:2|Redirect to Login Page:3]" Description="When a user comes to the site and is not logged in, how should the site respond."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Login Form" name="Login Page AddonID" ReadOnly="0" selector="[Default:0|ListID(Add-ons)]" description="When a non-logged-in user visits a blocked page, they are shown a page that includes just this addon. Set to Default and the system's login addon is used. To create a custom login, change this from 'Default' to an add-on that creates and processes a custom login process."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Anonymous User Login Page" name="LoginPageID" ReadOnly="0" Type="text" Selector="[Select One:0|listid(Page Content)]" Description="If 'Anonymous User Response' is set to 'Forward to Login Page', select the page here that non-logged-in user will be forwarded to. To create a custom login, create a page with a login and select it here.">0</SiteProperty> <CopyContent caption="Anonymous User Blocking Message" name="AnonymousUserResponseCopy" ReadOnly="0" html="true" Description="When 'Anonymous User Response' is set to Block with Message, guests to the site see this content for all pages."><p style="text-align:center;margin-top:100px;">This site is not available for anonymous access.</p></CopyContent> <SiteProperty caption="Default Template" name="Default TemplateId" ReadOnly="false" Type="Lookup" Selector="[ListID(Page Templates)]" Description="When a webpage is displayd in Page Manager as template is selected automatically. The system checks the page record, then the page's parent records, then the domain name record, then it checks this setting. If non of these are set, it uses the most recent template record."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="DocType Declaration" name="DocTypeDeclaration" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" EditorAddon="" Description="This is the DocType presented at the top of every page on the site."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Content Type (default)" name="Template Entity-Header Content-Type" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" EditorAddon="" Description="The default value for Content-Type returned in the response entity-header and in equivalant meta tag. Typically 'text/html; charset=utf-8'. Overridden by template record, or programmatically with cp.response.addHeader('Content-Type','text/html; charset=utf-8')">text/html; charset=utf-8</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Content Language (default)" name="Template Entity-Header Content-Language" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" EditorAddon="" Description="The Content-Language returned in the response entity-header and in equivalant meta tag. Typically 'en-us'. Overridden by template record, or programmatically with cp.response.addHeader('Content-Language','en-us').">en-us</SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Legacy" heading="Compatibility and Legacy Settings" description="Settings that affect older sites programmed using legacy or deprecated techniques"> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Legacy ToolsPanel" name="AllowLegacyToolsPanel" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="When un-checked, Page Content headline fields use the h1 tag. When checked, headlines are created with a span tag that includes a ccHeadline class. Unchecked is default. Checked is legacy.">0</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Use Content Watch Link" name="UseContentWatchLink" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="When checked, the content watch table may be used to create a link for a page that could not otherwise be determined. This is only appropriate for older sites that do not use the section-template interface.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Allow Content Watch Link Update" name="AllowContentWatchLinkUpdate" ReadOnly="0" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="Content Watch is a method of recording the URLs used for each page. The URL is always recorded when the page is first visited. Check the checkbox to also update content watch every time the content is viewed. On some older sites, menus and internal links are created from the Content Watch records. Clearing the checkbox will stop menu links from changing. This happens when uses use different domain names, or when pages are hit from other URL variations.">false</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Page Headline Field uses ccHeadline" name="PAGEHEADLINEUSECCHEADLINE" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="When un-checked, the Page Content headline field uses an h1 tag. When checked, headlines are created with a div tag that includes a ccHeadline class. Unchecked is default. Checked is legacy.">0</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="(legacy) AWS Access Key Id" name="AWS Access Key Id" ReadOnly="1" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This key is deprecated. It had been used for AWS SES email. Use the AWS credentials in the server configuration file in d:\contensive\config.json managed with the cc.exe command line program. Give this credentials the permissions for any resource needed on the site. Access the credentials programmatically with cp.ServerConfig."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="(legacy) AWS Secret Access Key" name="AWS Secret Access Key" ReadOnly="1" Type="text" Selector="" Description="This key is deprecated. It had been used for AWS SES email. Use the AWS credentials in the server configuration file in d:\contensive\config.json managed with the cc.exe command line program. Give this credentials the permissions for any resource needed on the site. Access the credentials programmatically with cp.ServerConfig."></SiteProperty> </Tab> <Tab name="Beta" heading="Beta features" description="Settings the affect unreleased and soft-released features. Only enable/disable if you understand the affects."> <SiteProperty caption="Website Edit/Add Enhancements" name="allow edit modal beta" ReadOnly="0" Type="Boolean" Description="When checked, the website edit and add tags change appearance and use the edit modal.">0</SiteProperty> </Tab> </Form>

Addon.name: Email Bounce Settings
Addon.FormXML: <Form> <Description></Description> <Tab name="AWS" description="Settings that affect the AWS Bounce and Complaint notification handling."> <SiteProperty caption="Allow AWS Email Bounce Processing" name="AWS SES Allow Bounce Process" ReadOnly="false" Type="boolean" Selector="" Description="(For Amazon AWS hosted sites only, requires Amazon SES Email) Use Amazon Notifications to automatically block bad email addresses from your database. When enabled, the site will check with Amazon AWS hourly and if bad email addresses where detected, the user's Allow Group Email will be disabled and the email address will be added to the site's blocked list.">0</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="AWS Transient Email Grace Period" name="AWS SES Transient Email Grace Period" ReadOnly="false" Type="text" Selector="" Description="The period of time up to 30 days that email addresses with transient issues will be allowed. You must periodically review the transient email issues in the Email Block List. Transient issues older than this period will be blocked from receiving email.">14</SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="AWS SQS Bounce Email Queue Endpoint" name="AWS SQS Bounce Email Queue Endpoint" ReadOnly="0" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="The URL for the AWS Message Queue you configured to store the bounce messages."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Legacy - AWS Access Key Id" name="AWS Access Key Id" ReadOnly="0" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="Legacy. The email process should use the application's IAM user, stored in the server configuration. This property over-rides that value and will be deprecated."></SiteProperty> <SiteProperty caption="Legacy - AWS Secret Access Key" name="AWS Secret Access Key" ReadOnly="0" Type="Text" Selector="" Description="Legacy. The email process should use the application's IAM user, stored in the server configuration. This property over-rides that value and will be deprecated."></SiteProperty> </Tab> </Form>
